question.body: The extracellular matrix of blood normally makes up what percent of the blood volume?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The plasma which is the extracellular matrix of blood makes up more than 25% of the blood volume.
Incorrect. The hematocrit or red blood cells make up 45% of the blood volume.
Correct. The plasma which is the extracellular matrix of blood makes up 55% of the blood.
Incorrect. The plasma, which is the extracellular matrix of blood, typically makes up less than 65% of the blood volume.
